page.title: 02North Cornish sayings
page.content:
We visited Mrs Moore at the Bush Inn and asked her if she knew any local sayings. These are the ones that she remembered. { {winicky}a sickly child {cheal}a baby {maid} a girl {mazed}a bit daft {nizel draft}a runt{d'rec'ly}presently {towser}sacking apron {teddy }potato {slottery} wet grass{chipples }onions {a brave step} a long walk {thick as a hedge} thick mist
Here is a list of Cornish dishes Pasty, splits or cut rounds, raw teddy figgy duff, teddy cake, raw teddy fry, currant roly-poly, cornish cake, leeky pie,lambtail pie, baby's 'ead, pickups nadlins, thunder and lightning
